diskovery_pipeline module¶

class diskovery_pipeline.Pipeline(dk, shader, set_layout)¶

Bases: object

cleanup()¶
get_shader_module(src)¶
make_pipeline()¶
make_pipeline_layout(set_layout)¶
class diskovery_pipeline.Shader(sources, definition, uniforms)¶

Bases: object

filenames = None¶

Shaders are typically written in a C-style language called GLSL. Vulkan does not interpret GLSL shaders, but instead a new, binary format called SPIR-V. Thankfully, included in the Vulkan SDK is an executable that allows GLSL shaders to be converted into SPIR-V format.

The following searches the directory where the shaders are located and formats the newly created SPIR-V shaders into a dictionary where they can be referenced by calling their stage in the shader.

This functionality requires that the GLSL shaders use file endings that correspond to their stages (e.g. *.vert, *.frag)
